Articles.Content:
You must visit every single body in all of the Kerbol system. Including Kerbol, every planet, every moon, every dwarf planet and any other celestial body in the Kerbol system. For it to qualify it must be orbiting or on the body, does not have to be inhabited, even if there is a kraken attack during your flight and you forgot to quick save it does not count, and it must be in stock KSP and no textures or mods, none at all. Edit: you can use any textures and MechJeb plus any kind of launch window alarm.

Edited April 11, 2020 by Ωmega7 spaceflight

43 minutes ago, Ωmega7 spaceflight said:

You must visit every single body in all of the Kerbol system. Including Kerbol, every planet, every moon, every dwarf planet and any other celestial body in the Kerbol system. For it to qualify it must be orbiting or on the body, does not have to be inhabited, even if there is a kraken attack during your flight and you forgot to quick save it does not count, and it must be in stock KSP and no textures or mods, none at all.

The texture mod rule seems really iffy...
Ok you can use textures and MechJeb plus any kind of launch window alarm

On 4/10/2020 at 10:45 AM, Ωmega7 spaceflight said:

You must visit every single body in all of the Kerbol system. Including Kerbol, every planet, every moon, every dwarf planet and any other celestial body in the Kerbol system. For it to qualify it must be orbiting or on the body, does not have to be inhabited, even if there is a kraken attack during your flight and you forgot to quick save it does not count, and it must be in stock KSP and no textures or mods, none at all. Edit: you can use any textures and MechJeb plus any kind of launch window alarm.

Could you possibly list some rules, maybe make a badge or two?

On 4/11/2020 at 1:12 PM, Ωmega7 spaceflight said:

Ok you can use textures and MechJeb plus any kind of launch window alarm

 

The rules state that you have to have done the challenge before posting. (As far as I’ve seen). Pics? Video? Ship?

also, using MechJeb as an autopilot is very cheaty.
